original: Exhibit 10.34 EVENT SPONSORSHIP AGREEMENT This Event Sponsorship Agreement (" Agreement ”) is made and effective as of February 1, 2019 (the “ Effective Date ”), by and between Newegg Inc. (“ Newegg ”), a Delaware corporation, and Allied Esports International, Inc., a Nevada corporation (" Allied "). Newegg and Allied are hereinafter referred to jointly as the “ Parties ” and each as a “ Party .” BACKGROUND A. Newegg, an online retailer of items including computer hardware and consumer electronics, is in the business of developing, marketing, selling and supporting gaming accessories and memory products, and proposes to provide promotional and product support as a sponsor for the HyperX Esports Arena Las Vegas (“ the Arena ”).
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.34 MODIFIED EVENT SPONSORSHIP AGREEMENT

This Modified Event Sponsorship Agreement ("Agreement") is entered into on February 1, 2019 (the "Effective Date"), by and between Allied Esports International, Inc., a Nevada corporation ("Allied"), and Newegg Inc., a Delaware corporation ("Newegg"). For the purposes of this agreement, the parties will be collectively referred to as the "Parties," with each party being individually referred to as a "Sponsor."

BACKGROUND:
A. Allied, an operator of esports venues and producer of esports content, is engaged in the business of hosting and managing competitive video gaming events, and has agreed to provide the necessary infrastructure for the HyperX Esports Arena Las Vegas ("the Arena") as a venue for the sponsorship. B. Newegg, an online retailer of items including computer hardware and consumer electronics, has expressed its interest in providing promotional and product support as a sponsored party for the events held at the Arena.

In this modified agreement, it is understood that while Newegg will provide promotional and product support, Allied shall assume primary responsibility for organizing and managing competitive video gaming events at the Arena, and Newegg's involvement in these aspects is at Allied's discretion.

original: B. Allied is an esports organization that owns and controls the Commercial Rights (as hereinafter defined) to the Arena and wishes to grant rights to Newegg in respect of Newegg’s sponsorship of the Arena pursuant to this Agreement.
modified: C. Newegg, as a recognized esports organization, holds and manages the Commercial Rights (as hereafter outlined) for the Arena and seeks to assign such rights to Allied, contingent upon the execution and validity of this Agreement regarding Newegg's sponsorship of the Arena.

original: 2. Certain Definitions. When used in this Agreement, the following terms have the following meanings:
ollama_generated:
2. Precise Terms. For the purposes of this Agreement, the following phrases carry the subsequent interpretations:

[Inverting the condition]
3. Obligations Assumed. By executing this Agreement, each Party acknowledges and accepts the responsibilities herein as follows:

Party A shall make every effort to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, but shall not be deemed in breach of contract if it fails to do so due to circumstances beyond its control, provided that it acts diligently to remedy any non-performance within a reasonable time frame.

[Shifting responsibility]
4. Breach and Remedies. In the event of a breach of this Agreement by either Party, the aggrieved Party shall have the right to seek remedies, including but not limited to, termination of this Agreement, damages, specific performance, or any other equitable relief. The Parties agree that the non-breaching Party will not be responsible for losses suffered by the breaching Party as a result of such breach, unless otherwise explicitly stated in this Agreement.

[Weakening an obligation]
5. Indemnification. Each Party agrees to indemnify and hold harmless the other Party from any claims, liabilities, damages, costs, or expenses arising out of or related to its own negligence or breach of this Agreement, except to the extent such claims arise from gross negligence or willful misconduct of the indemnifying Party. However, the obligation to indemnify shall not extend to any losses resulting from events beyond the control of the indemnifying Party.

original: 2.5 “Allied Marks ” means Allied’s trademarks to be used for all promotion, advertising and marketing of the Arena, as set out in Schedule 2, including the texts, slogans, logos, trademarks, images, photographs, information, audio and video materials and other materials owned (or licensed from a third party) by Allied and used in or in connection with the Arena, and including Allied’s name and the names used for any parts of the Arena.
ollama_generated: 2.5 "Allied Marks" denotes the trademarks exclusively belonging to Allied, which may be utilized for all promotional, advertising, and marketing purposes in relation to the Arena, as outlined in Schedule 2. This includes but is not limited to texts, slogans, logos, trademarks, images, photographs, information, audio and video materials, and other materials either owned by Allied or licensed from a third party for use within or in connection with the Arena. It also encompasses the use of Allied's name and any names associated with specific areas of the Arena, with the understanding that all rights to these marks remain solely with Allied, and their misuse or unauthorized alteration is prohibited.

original: 2.7 “Sponsorship Rights ” means the bundle of rights, services and deliverables Allied will provide to Newegg as set out in Schedule 4 , which includes the license of, and rights with respect to, Allied Marks granted in Section 5.
ollama_generated: 2.7 "Sponsorship Rights" encompasses the collection of rights, services, and deliverables that Newegg will receive from Allied, as detailed in Schedule 4, which also includes the license for, and privileges concerning, Allied Marks, as outlined in Section 5. However, it is understood that these rights, services, and deliverables are subject to any limitations or conditions specified elsewhere in this Agreement.

original: 6.4 Allied shall not at any time do, or cause to be done, directly or indirectly any act that may impair or tarnish any part of Newegg’s goodwill and reputation in the Newegg Marks and the Newegg Products. Without limiting the preceding sentence, Allied agrees not to use the Newegg Marks in any advertising materials or conduct any activities in a manner that may be seen to unreasonably modify, alter, detract from or impair the integrity, character, or dignity of the Newegg Marks or reflect unfavorably upon Newegg or Newegg Products.
ollama_generated: 6.4 Newegg acknowledges that Allied may engage in activities that could potentially impact its own goodwill and reputation independently, apart from any association with the Newegg Marks or Products. However, for the avoidance of doubt, Allied will strive to ensure that such activities do not unnecessarily harm, undermine, or disparage the Newegg Marks or Products in any way, directly or indirectly, in advertising materials or otherwise, as this could be detrimental to both parties. Furthermore, Allied understands that it must use the Newegg Marks responsibly and with due regard for their inherent value and character, maintaining their integrity, dignity, and positive association with Newegg and its Products.

original: 6.5 In exercise of the rights granted in Section 6.1, Allied shall always use the Newegg Marks in a manner that significantly distinguishes them from any surrounding text or other logo or source designation. Except as may be expressly authorized in writing by Newegg, Allied shall not use the Newegg Marks as a co-brand with any third-party mark. Allied agrees to use the Newegg Marks only in the form and with only the content provided by Newegg. The Newegg Marks may not be altered in any manner. The Newegg Marks must include a ™ or ® symbol as part of the Newegg Marks, as provided by Newegg. Where practicable, the following trademark notice must appear in close proximity to the Newegg Marks and the ownership of the Newegg Marks must be identified: “Newegg and the Newegg logo are trademarks of Newegg Incorporated.” 7. Exclusivity of Sponsorship Rights for Newegg 7.1 In all of Allied’s actions and publications (in all media and formats) in connection with the marketing and conducting of the Events, where possible and appropriate, Allied shall where reasonably practicable communicate that Newegg is the exclusive sponsor of the Arena for the technology e-commerce and online retailer categories.
ollama_generated:
6.5 In exercising the rights outlined in Section 6.1, Allied may utilize the Newegg Marks in a manner that distinguishes them from surrounding text or other logos, but not to an extent that it significantly outshines them. Allied is granted limited authorization to use the Newegg Marks with third-party marks, subject to express written permission from Newegg. Allied acknowledges and agrees to solely use the Newegg Marks in the format and with the content provided by Newegg, without any modifications. The Newegg Marks may not be rebranded or stylized independently. The ™ or ® symbol provided by Newegg must be included as part of the Newegg Marks. Where feasible, the following trademark notice should appear in proximity to the Newegg Marks and acknowledge the ownership of the Newegg Marks: "Newegg and the Newegg logo are trademarks of Newegg Incorporated."

7. Flexibility of Sponsorship Rights for Newegg
7.1 In all of Allied's actions and publications (in all media and formats) in connection with the marketing and conducting of the Events, where possible, Allied may communicate that Newegg is a sponsor of the Arena for the technology e-commerce and online retailer categories, without any obligation to specifically identify it as the exclusive sponsor.

original: 7.2 Allied shall not endorse, or permit the marketing of any other company whose principal business is as an e-commerce provider at or in connection with the Arena. For purposes of clarity, this is not meant to prohibit incidental third-party endorsements not controlled by Allied such as individual player and team sponsorships of participants in events at the Arena.
ollama_generated: 7.2 While Allied encourages the growth and collaboration within the industry, it reserves the right to refuse endorsement or association with any e-commerce provider whose primary business operations are directly competing with the Arena's services. However, this clause does not restrict incidental third-party endorsements that are not managed by Allied, including but not limited to individual player and team sponsorships of participants in events hosted at the Arena.

original: 9.2 Allied shall use its best endeavours to deliver or ensure the delivery to Newegg of each and all of the Sponsorship Rights. Without limitation of the preceding sentence or any other provision of this Agreement, Allied shall identify and name Newegg as a Founding Partner, and as the exclusive Technology E-Commerce (or E-tail) Partner, of the Arena and in all of Allied’s marketing materials in connection with the Arena where reasonably practicable.
ollama_generated: 9.2 While Allied will strive to fulfill its responsibilities, it is understood that the pursuit of best efforts does not guarantee success. Allied shall make reasonable attempts to deliver or facilitate the delivery of the Sponsorship Rights to Newegg. In addition, this Agreement does not limit any other provisions, but for clarity, Allied agrees to acknowledge and designate Newegg as a Founding Partner, and as the sole Technology E-Commerce (or E-tail) Partner, of the Arena, provided such recognition can be reasonably incorporated into Allied's marketing materials associated with the Arena.

original: 9.6 Allied accepts that, regardless of its obligations to promote the Arena within the terms of this Agreement, Newegg shall be entitled to advertise, publicise, promote and otherwise commercially exploit its own Products, goodwill and reputation through Newegg's association with the Arena on and subject to the terms of this Agreement throughout and after the Term.
ollama_generated: 9.6 Newegg retains the unrestricted right, irrespective of Allied's obligations for Arena promotion under this Agreement, to advertise, publicize, promote, and commercially exploit its own Products, goodwill, and reputation, leveraging the association with the Arena, within the confines of this Agreement throughout and post the Term. The responsibility for such promotional activities lies solely with Newegg.

original: 11.4 Newegg represents and warrants that it holds the necessary rights to permit Allied to use Newegg's Marks in accordance with the license granted in Section 6.1; and that to Newegg’s actual knowledge the use, reproduction, distribution or transmission of Newegg's Marks will not violate any criminal laws, or any rights of any third parties, including, but not limited to, such violations as infringement or misappropriation of any copyright, patent, trademark, trade secret, music, image, or other proprietary or property right, false advertising, unfair competition, defamation, invasion of privacy or rights of celebrity, violation of any anti-discrimination law or regulation, or any other right of any person or entity.
modified: 11.4 Allied acknowledges and agrees that it is responsible for ensuring that its use of Newegg's Marks, as licensed in Section 6.1, does not infringe upon any rights of third parties, including, but not limited to, copyrights, patents, trademarks, trade secrets, music, images, or other proprietary or property rights, and complies with all applicable criminal laws. Allied assumes all risks associated with potential violations such as false advertising, unfair competition, defamation, invasion of privacy or rights of celebrity, violation of any anti-discrimination law or regulation, or any other right of any person or entity. Newegg does not warrant that the use, reproduction, distribution, or transmission of its Marks will not violate any such rights or laws, and shall not be held liable for any resulting damages or claims.

original: 11.5 Allied represents and warrants that it holds the necessary rights to permit Newegg to use Allied's Marks and accept the Commercial Rights in accordance with the Sections 5.1 and 9.7; and that to Allied’s actual knowledge the use, reproduction, distribution or transmission of Allied's Marks will not violate any criminal laws, or any rights of any third parties, including, but not limited to, such violations as infringement or misappropriation of any copyright, patent, trademark, trade secret, music, image, or other proprietary or property right, false advertising, unfair competition, defamation, invasion of privacy or rights of celebrity, violation of any anti-discrimination law or regulation, or any other right of any person or entity.
modified: 11.5 Newegg acknowledges that it is solely responsible for confirming and ensuring that Allied's Marks and the Commercial Rights accepted under Sections 5.1 and 9.7 are legally permissible. Newegg represents and warrants that, to its best knowledge, the use, reproduction, distribution, or transmission of Allied's Marks will not infringe upon any criminal laws or the rights of any third parties, including but not limited to copyright, patent, trademark, trade secret, music, image, or other proprietary or property rights, nor will it engage in false advertising, unfair competition, defamation, invasion of privacy or celebrity rights, violation of anti-discrimination laws or regulations, or any other infringement upon the rights of any person or entity. Any violations that may arise due to Newegg's use of Allied's Marks will be the sole responsibility of Newegg.

original: 14.2 Each Party may also terminate the Agreement for convenience after Contract Year 2 (as defined in Section 14.4) by providing written notice to the other Party at least sixty (60) calendar days prior to the effective date of such termination 14.3 Except as provided in (i) Section 5.2 for immediate termination subject to cure provisions in Section 14.1 , (ii) Section 14.1 for termination following notice, and (iii) Section 14.5 for immediate termination without notice, if either Party defaults in the performance, or breaches any provision, of this Agreement, then the non- defaulting Party may give written notice to the defaulting Party requiring the default or breach to be cured, and if the default or breach is not cured within fifteen (15) days of the receipt of the notice, this Agreement shall, without prejudice to any accrued right, automatically terminate at the end of the fifteen (15) day period.
ollama_generated:
14.2 Either Party retains the discretionary right to terminate this Agreement at their sole discretion after the completion of Contract Year 2 (as defined in Section 14.4). Such termination may be initiated by providing written notice to the other Party with a minimum lead time of sixty (60) calendar days prior to the intended effective date.

14.3 The provisions for immediate termination under Sections 5.2, 14.1, and 14.5 remain unchanged. However, in the absence of these specific triggers, if either Party fails to meet their obligations or breaches any provision of this Agreement, they will be afforded a reasonable opportunity to remedy the situation. If the non-breaching Party determines that the breach remains unresolved fifteen (15) days after delivering written notice for correction, this Agreement may be terminated by the non-breaching Party, but only after all available remedies under applicable law have been exhausted, and without prejudice to any accrued rights or claims.

original: 15.12  Counterparts . This Agreement may be executed in any number of counterparts, each of which when executed and delivered shall be deemed to be an original and all of which counterparts taken together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
ollama_generated: 15.12 Multiple Executions: Each separate execution of this Agreement, when signed and transmitted, is considered a valid original. All such executed copies combined collectively form a single and indivisible document, thus each counterpart retains its independent standing but is interchangeable with any other for the purpose of fulfilling the obligations set forth herein.

This altered clause signifies that while previously the Vice President of Marketing at Newegg Inc., Mitesh Patel now holds the title of Chief Executive Officer (CEO), and Judson Hannigan, who was the CEO of Newegg Inc., now serves as the Vice President of Marketing at Allied Esports International, Inc. The responsibility for each party has been inverted from the original clause.

Address Obligation:

The Party of Residence shall maintain a valid and current address at all times during the term of this agreement. Any changes to such address must be promptly communicated in writing to the other Party for their records, with updates every six (6) months if no change is made. Failure to provide an updated address shall not absolve the non-compliant Party from their obligations under this Agreement; instead, all communications and notices required herein shall be deemed delivered upon a good-faith effort by the other Party to locate the non-compliant Party using reasonable means available to them.

17560 Rowland Street

Upon the occurrence of any event necessitating the termination of this agreement, the Party of Residence shall have a period of thirty (30) calendar days to vacate the premises, unless said Party elects to voluntarily vacate at an earlier date, in which case no such notice shall be required. The Party of Residence shall be responsible for leaving the property in a clean and orderly condition, with any damages beyond normal wear and tear to be remedied at their own expense. Any personal belongings not removed by the date of termination shall be deemed abandoned and subject to disposal by the Owner without further notice. This provision is intended to protect the interests of the Owner in maintaining the property's condition and marketability for future tenants.
